security: Releasing crypt LINLUCK without further review or redaction could expose sensitive sources and methods. Quoting directly: "Crypt LINLUCK -- ARRB staff did not find our evidence memo on this crypt persuasive. They are expected to recommend that the Board reaffirm its decision to release."
summary: This memo outlines the agenda for the ARRB meeting on January 22, 1998, including reconsideration of the State Cover, discussion of personnel files and non-related files in the Sequestered Collection, and possible items such as ARRB Request # CIA 1 and the crypt LINLUCK.
summary_one_paragraph: J. Barry Harrelson informs John Pereira, Fred Wickham, and Lee Strickland about the upcoming ARRB meeting agenda for January 22, 1998, which will include reconsideration of the State Cover, a discussion on whether to declare personnel files and non-related files in the Sequestered Collection as NBR (Not Believed Relevant), possible discussion of ARRB Request # CIA 1 concerning DO documents, and the crypt LINLUCK for which the ARRB staff found the evidence memo unpersuasive. The memo also mentions re-reviewing the 1967 IG report on "Castro Assassination Plots" and provides contact information for any questions regarding the agenda items.
title: ARRB 22 January Meeting -- Agenda
recipient: John Pereira, Fred Wickham, Lee Strickland
